alert.note: Alert for McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 11 at 1:19AM CDT until April 11 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Newton County in southwestern Missouri... McDonald County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 200 AM CDT. * At 118 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Quapaw to Wyandotte to near Fairland to Cleora, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Southern Joplin... Neosho... Big Sugar Creek State Park... Seneca... Granby... Anderson... Noel... Duquesne... Dodge... Goodman... South West City... Diamond... Pineville... Loma Linda... Wheaton... Leawood... Silver Creek... Lanagan... Fairview... Shoal Creek Drive... This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 35. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
